page.title: 07INGLESBATCH SERVICES
page.content: The only permanent services in the hamlet are a telephone box and a post box. Deliveries of milk, bread, meat etc. arrive on a regular basis. A mobile library visits weekly and refuse is collected regularly. Mains electricity and water are available. A mini-bus service, twice weekly, to and from Bath is the nearest public transport. The only other bus service is more than a mile away. The majority of residents have their own transport to reach the nearest church and post office at Englishcombe. The nearest doctors, dentists and hospitals are in Bath. Most purchases of food clothing and household items involve car travel No schools are found in this area; all pupils have to be transported to and from school. The local villages have some sport, dancing facilities and other spare time pursuits.
